quote: Love all, but trust a few.
All that I have seen teaches me to trust the Creator for all I have not seen.
As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live.
Cardinal rule for all hitters with two strikes on them: Never trust the umpire.
A good marriage is at least 80 percent good luck in finding the right person at the right time. The rest is trust.
All empire is no more than power in trust.
As contagion of sickness makes sickness, contagion of trust can make trust.
Believe a woman or an epitaph,
Love all, but trust a few.
All that I have seen teaches me to trust the Creator for all I have not seen.
As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live.
Cardinal rule for all hitters with two strikes on them: Never trust the umpire.
A good marriage is at least 80 percent good luck in finding the right person at the right time. The rest is trust.
All empire is no more than power in trust.
As contagion of sickness makes sickness, contagion of trust can make trust.
Believe a woman or an epitaph,
Do not trust to the cheering, for those persons would shout as much if you and I were going to be hanged.
Every sale has five basic obstacles: no need, no money, no hurry, no desire, no trust.
Every sale has five basic obstacles: no need, no money, no hurry, no desire, no trust.
Faith is a reasoning trust, a trust which reckons thoughtfully and confidently upon the trustworthiness of God.
Faith is a state of openness or trust.
Fear secretes acids; but love and trust are sweet juices.
Few things help an individual more than to place responsibility upon him, and to let him know that you trust him.
First, then, a woman will or won't, depend on 't;
For somehow this disease inheres in tyranny, never to trust one's friends.
How hard it is, sometimes, to trust the evidence of one's senses! How reluctantly the mind consents to reality.
I cannot trust a man to control others who cannot control himself.
I could I trust starve like a gentleman. It's listed as part of the poetic training, you know.
I don't trust him. We're friends.
I know God will not give me anything I can't handle. I just wish that He didn't trust me so much.
I work in a strange business, and trust is a word that's not even in the vocabulary.
If people like you, they'll listen to you, but if they trust you, they'll do business with you.
In America few people will trust you unless you are irreverent.
In every tyrant's heart there springs in the end this poison, that he cannot trust a friend.
It is a lesson which all history teaches wise men, to put trust in ideas, and not in circumstances.
It is better to suffer wrong than to do it, and happier to be sometimes cheated than not to trust.
It is impossible to go through life without trust: that is to be imprisoned in the worst cell of all, oneself.
Just trust yourself, then you will know how to live.
Knowledge is gained by learning; trust by doubt; skill by practice; love by love.
Let every eye negotiate for itself and trust no agent.
London is full of women who trust their husbands. One can always recognize them. They look so thoroughly unhappy.
Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.
Men are able to trust one another, knowing the exact degree of dishonesty they are entitled to expect.
Never be afraid to trust an unknown future to a known God.
Never trust a husband too far, nor a bachelor too near.
Never trust a man who speaks well of everybody.
Never trust the advice of a man in difficulties.
Never trust the teller, trust the tale.
Nobody expects to trust his body overmuch after the age of fifty.
Oh yet we trust that somehow good will be the final goal of ill!
Old wood best to burn, old wine to drink, old friends to trust, and old authors to read.
One can always trust to time. Insert a wedge of time and nearly everything straightens itself out.
One should never trust a woman who tells her real age. If she tells that, she'll tell anything.
One should never trust a woman who tells her real age. If she tells that, she'll tell anything.
Only trust thyself, and another shall not betray thee.
Put more trust in nobility of character than in an oath.
Put not your trust in money, but put your money in trust.
Put your trust in God and keep your powder dry.
So near is falsehood to truth that a wise man would do well not to trust himself on the narrow edge.
The 'public' scares me, but people I trust.
The best fights don't occur between strangers. They occur between friends who trust each other.
The best proof of love is trust.
The only way to make a man trustworthy is to trust him.
The schoolmaster is abroad! And I trust to him armed with his primer against the soldier in full military array.
The true and solid peace of nations consists not in equality of arms, but in mutual trust alone.
The trust of the innocent is the liar's most useful tool.
The way to learn whether a person is trustworthy is to trust him.
Therefore trust to thy heart, and to what the world calls illusions.
Those who trust to chance must abide by the results of chance.
Those who trust us educate us.
Trust everybody, but cut the cards.
Trust him not with your secrets, who, when left alone in your room, turns over your papers.
Trust in the person's promise, who dares to refuse what they fear they cannot perform.
Trust instinct to the end, even though you can give no reason.
Trust is the lubrication that makes it possible for organizations to work.
Trust me not at all, or all in all.
Trust men and they will be true to you.
Trust men and they will be true to you; treat them greatly and they will show themselves great.
Trust no friend without faults, and love a woman, but no angel.
Trust not in him that seems a saint.
Trust not the horse, O Trojans. Be it what it may, I fear the Grecians even when they offer gifts.
Trust not to much to appearances.
Trust not too much to an enchanting face.
Trust not yourself, but your defects to know, make use of every friend and every foe.
Trust one who has tried.
Trust should be the basis for all our moral training.
Trust thyself: every heart vibrates to that iron string.
Trust who and what you are, and the universe will support you in miraculous ways.
Trust your hunches. They're usually based on facts filed away just below the conscious level.
Trust your instinct to the end, though you can render no reason.
Trust yourself, then you will know how to live.
Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do.
Trust, but verify.
We are all selfish and I no more trust myself than others with a good motive.
We need, in effect, to make the phantom 'lock-boxes' around the trust fund real.
When a man assumes a public trust he should consider himself a public property.
When a man assumes a public trust, he should consider himself as public property.
When a man has no reason to trust himself, he trusts in luck.
Where large sums of money are concerned, it is advisable to trust nobody.
Who would not rather trust and be deceived?
Woe to the man whose heart has not learned while young to hope, to love - and to put its trust in life.
You can't trust water: Even a straight stick turns crooked in it.
You have to trust your body to take care of you.
You may be deceived if you trust too much, but you will live in torment if you don't trust enough.
Your every voter, as surely as your chief magistrate, exercises a public trust.
Don't trust the person who has broken faith once.
Empires built on force will always be destroyed. Those built on trust in Christ will remain.
